testability_scores.hypothesis_title: Integrated Digital Health Ecosystem for Atrial Fibrillation Management

measurability.assessment: Highly measurable outcomes (hospitalizations, QoL scores, adherence metrics)

feasibility.assessment: Technically feasible with current technology, requires significant coordination

ethical_considerations.assessment: Moderate ethical complexity - data privacy and equity concerns

resource_requirements.assessment: High resource needs - technology development, training, infrastructure

technical_difficulty.assessment: High technical complexity but achievable with current capabilities

proposed_study_design.control_group: Standard AF care with usual monitoring

measurability.assessment: Highly measurable clinical outcomes with established metrics

feasibility.assessment: Highly feasible with existing genomic testing infrastructure

ethical_considerations.assessment: Minimal ethical complexity - standard clinical testing with enhanced personalization

resource_requirements.assessment: Moderate resource requirements for testing and implementation

technical_difficulty.assessment: Moderate technical difficulty with established methodologies

proposed_study_design.control_group: Standard anticoagulation selection based on clinical factors
proposed_study_design.statistical_analysis: Time-to-event analysis with Cox proportional hazards models

testability_scores.hypothesis_title: AI-Powered Risk Stratification for AF Progression

measurability.assessment: Measurable outcomes with defined progression criteria

feasibility.assessment: Feasible with existing AI development frameworks and clinical data

ethical_considerations.assessment: Minimal ethical issues beyond standard predictive modeling

resource_requirements.assessment: Moderate requirements for data collection and model development

technical_difficulty.assessment: Moderate technical difficulty with current ML capabilities

proposed_study_design.design_type: Prospective Cohort Study with Nested Randomized Trial
proposed_study_design.nested_trial: Randomized comparison of model-guided vs standard care
proposed_study_design.statistical_analysis: Machine learning validation metrics with clinical utility assessment

measurability.assessment: Well-established outcome metrics with equity-focused measures

feasibility.assessment: Highly feasible with existing telemedicine infrastructure

ethical_considerations.assessment: Addresses health equity - ethically compelling approach

resource_requirements.assessment: Moderate requirements focused on outreach and adaptation

technical_difficulty.assessment: Low to moderate technical difficulty with existing platforms

proposed_study_design.design_type: Community-Based Participatory Research Cluster Randomized Trial
proposed_study_design.statistical_analysis: Mixed methods with quantitative outcomes and qualitative process evaluation

testability_scores.hypothesis_title: Long-Term (>10 Year) Outcomes of Catheter Ablation vs Medical Therapy

measurability.assessment: Clear long-term outcomes but requires extended follow-up

feasibility.assessment: Feasible but challenging due to long time horizon

ethical_considerations.assessment: Standard clinical research with minimal additional risk

resource_requirements.assessment: High resource requirements due to extended duration

technical_difficulty.assessment: Low technical difficulty with established procedures

proposed_study_design.follow_up_strategy: Annual clinical visits with remote monitoring
proposed_study_design.data_collection: Clinical outcomes, patient-reported outcomes, economic data
proposed_study_design.statistical_analysis: Time-to-event analysis with competing risk models

immediate_priorities: H002 - Genomic-guided anticoagulation (high feasibility, high impact)
H004 - Health equity telemedicine (ethical imperative, feasible)
medium_term_development: H003 - AI risk stratification (moderate complexity, high value)
H008 - Lifestyle prevention (high feasibility, moderate cost)
high_risk_high_reward: H010 - Neural interface (paradigm shifting but high risk)
